newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RUGBY UNION-ACT UPSET QUEENSLAND TO ENHANCE REPUTATION.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-ACT UPSET QUEENSLAND TO ENHANCE REPUTATION.

text.p: Australian Capital Territory (ACT), the surprise package in Super 12 last season, further enhanced their reputation with an upset 24-19 away win against Queensland on Saturday.
Centres Pat Howard and Adam Magro and fullback Steve Larkham scored tries while flyhalf David Knox kicked three conversions and a penalty to stun the home crowd at Ballymore.
The defeat ruined Queensland coach John Connolly's celebrations on the day he confirmed his decision to extend his current contract to lead Queensland again next season.

ACT, who confounded their critics by narrowly missing out on a semifinal berth at their first attempt in the competition last season after being widely tipped to struggle, dominated the forward battle in a highly committed display.
Australia test winger Joe Roff, a constant threat the Queensland defence, produced two flashes of brilliance to create tries for Howard and Magro.

Queensland, who reached the semifinals last season before losing to South African province Natal, suffered a blow when scrumhalf Elton Moncrieff was forced to leave the field with a head injury early in the game.

Australia test centre Tim Horan scored two tries for Queensland and winger Barry Lea also crossed the line late in the game to give the home side a single competition point for losing by less than seven points.
Wallaby second row forward John Eales also landed two conversions.
Connolly said he was extremely disappointed with his side's opening performance.
"We just handed the ball back all the time," he said. "When we had it we couldn't hold it for more than one phase and you can't win the game like that."
